title: show - WI Improve UI - feature update repo url Closes #156
body:
## 📋 PR Title

`<ship|show|ask>-WI <work_item_name>-feature <functionality>`

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.
    - show: It is used to merge development branches with the continuous integration branch develop in easy or intermediate level tasks. Here a pull request is required with more stringent automatic CI validations, ensuring that the implementation is consistent and correct before integration.
    - ask: It is used in merging development branches with the continuous integration branch for tasks of high or intermediate complexity, as well as in any merge of develop with the main production branch. In these cases, CI validations must be completed successfully and a review by the work team is necessary, with a minimum of one review recommended and even two to ensure the quality of the code before final integration.



---

## 📝 Description  

Explain your implemented changes briefly or detailed (OPTIONAL) AND WAIT FOR WORKFLOWS TO EXECUTE AND PASS 
(IT IS A MUST, NOT A RECOMMENDATION)

title: show - WI_Weather_forecast - feature_add_Seville_weather_widget
body:
## 📋 PR Title

`show-WI Weather forecast-feature add Seville weather widget`

**PR Type:**  

- show

---

## 📝 Description  

This PR integrates a real-time weather widget for Seville into the home page using WeatherWidget.io. The widget provides dynamic weather updates, including temperature, conditions, and an icon representing the current weather. 

**Key changes include**:
1. Adding the embeddable HTML and script code for the widget to the home page template.
2. Styling adjustments to ensure seamless integration with the existing page layout.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

 ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities 

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.


---

## 📝 Description  

Implemented the functionality to store and track last_update_id for Telegram bot updates. 
This ensures that the bot fetches only new updates after the previous ones have been processed. 
Also, improved the offset logic to handle consecutive updates without retrieving the same messages.
Wait for workflows to execute and pass.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.

---

## 📝 Description  

Ensure that workflows skip processing ship PRs if one or more checks have failed. 
Updated the conditional logic to correctly evaluate `FAILURE_COUNT` using `-ge` operator. 
This avoids unnecessary retries or further processing for non-mergeable PRs.

body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.

---

## 📝 Description  

- Fixed improper usage of GitHub Actions syntax (${github.event.pull_request.number} in bash scripts).
- Improved error handling for gh CLI and jq commands.
- Refactored merge logic to ensure reliable PR merge conditions.
- Added detailed logs and validation checks for failed workflows.
- Structured bash script for better readability and maintainability.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.


---

## 📝 Description  

This update modifies the auto-merge workflow to ensure that it waits for other workflows to execute and pass before proceeding with the merge. The workflow now includes a loop that checks the status of the checks associated with a pull request (PR). It ensures that all checks have passed or that there is exactly one failed check. If these conditions are met, it verifies whether the PR is mergeable and proceeds with the merge.

The critical aspect of this update is the addition of a waiting mechanism, where the workflow will repeatedly check the PR's status until the desired condition (either all checks passing or only one check failing) is met. This prevents the workflow from attempting to merge a PR before all relevant checks have finished, ensuring that only fully validated PRs are merged.

This is a necessary step to prevent merging incomplete or untested changes and ensure that the PR is in a stable state before merging. The workflow will pause and retry the status check every 30 seconds until the condition is fulfilled.

title: show - Wi fakenodo - feature tests
body:
This pull request includes significant updates to the testing framework for the `fakenodo` module by enhancing the locust tests, removing outdated Selenium tests, and updating unit tests to cover new API endpoints. The most important changes include the following:

### Locust Tests Enhancements:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/locustfile.py`](diffhunk://#diff-d7d9536fcb275c514388d692c2f2832fb6ca8747db05683ce754755c6f81032fL1-R39): Replaced `TaskSet` with `HttpUser` and added new tasks to simulate GET, POST, DELETE, and publish requests to various endpoints of the `fakenodo` API. This enhances the testing coverage and simulates more realistic user interactions.

### Selenium Tests Removal:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/test_selenium.py`](diffhunk://#diff-629f7a0a765ad26ae0e7fedf4047f75b91de3a5093f18689055c67d4877aa1baL1-L35): Removed the outdated Selenium test `test_fakenodo_index` which was no longer necessary. This simplifies the test suite and removes dependencies on Selenium.

### Unit Tests Updates:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/test_unit.py`](diffhunk://#diff-f80010354976b599e2423b71b0461e00351867ee589bafdab01a09a87888323bR3-R74): Updated the unit tests to include new tests for the `fakenodo` API endpoints. This includes tests for connection, creation, file deposition, deletion, publication, and retrieval of depositions. These tests ensure that the API endpoints are functioning correctly and return the expected responses.

title: show - WI Download all datasets - feature test all cases
body:
This pull request includes significant changes to the `app/modules/download/tests/locustfile.py` file, which refactor the test structure and add new test tasks. 

Refactoring and new test tasks:

* Replaced `TaskSet` with `HttpUser` and added a `wait_time` between tasks to simulate user behavior more realistically.
* Modified the `index` task to remove the response status code check and added three new tasks: `download_all`, `download_datasets_by_date`, and `download_datasets_by_email`.
* Removed the `DownloadBehavior` class and directly assigned tasks to the `DownloadUser` class.
* Removed unnecessary imports and replaced them with relevant ones for the new structure.

title: show - Wi download all datasets - feature download all dataset
body:
This pull request includes significant updates to the testing framework for the download module. The changes involve restructuring the Selenium tests and adding unit tests with mock objects to improve test coverage and reliability.

### Selenium Tests Update:

* Replaced the old `test_download_index` function with a new `TestDownloaddall` class that includes multiple test methods for different download scenarios, improving the organization and readability of the Selenium tests.

### Unit Tests Enhancement:

* Added new unit tests in `test_unit.py` to cover dataset download functionalities using mock objects. This includes tests for downloading datasets by date range and by email, which enhances the test coverage and ensures more reliable testing.
* Introduced fixtures for `DataSetService`, `mock_user`, `mock_datasets`, and `DownloadService` to streamline the setup of test dependencies and improve test isolation.

title: show - WI Improve UI - feature explore view
body:
This pull request includes significant updates to the explore module, focusing on improving the user interface for filtering and sorting datasets, as well as adding new Selenium test.

### User Interface Improvements:

* [`app/modules/explore/assets/scripts.js`](diffhunk://#diff-3321c76be6a6ee4de1e246c0ddfe9b6cb87030339d51757a46778fbaa179c750L24-R24): Changed the sorting mechanism to use a dropdown menu instead of radio buttons.
* [`app/modules/explore/templates/explore/index.html`](diffhunk://#diff-7ef82ccde6aaf3cedd50d541340669fc2bdfe1311a06228b995f6d522ea9b0ceL9-L19): Updated the HTML structure to include a dedicated filters section with a card layout, added input fields for query and sorting, and improved the overall alignment and styling.

### Testing Enhancements:

* [`app/modules/explore/tests/test_selenium.py`](diffhunk://#diff-313e5cc570083292ed71662a27b63a94573c5480341f230a6f8787b78724a9e1R1-R251): Added new Selenium tests to automate the testing of the explore module's filtering and sorting functionalities, ensuring the user interface behaves as expected.

title: show - WI Improve UI - feature sorted listing of datasets Closes #6
body:
Implementation of a new sorting feature for the dataset listing, enhancing the user interface by allowing users to sort datasets based on various criteria.

**Changes:**

- Added multiple sorting options (alphabetical, date created and feature models).
- Consolidated all sorting options into a single button for a cleaner UI.
